title: [BUG] BoxCoxTransformer does not ignore y, possible also other SeriesToSeriesTransformers affected?
body:
**Describe the bug**
BoxCoxTransformer does not ignore X, possible also other SeriesToSeriesTransformers affected?

Error:
```python
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-d6890121a38e> in <module>
     24 
     25 box = BoxCoxTransformer()
---> 26 box.fit(y_train, X_train)

~.\sktime\transformations\base.py in fit(self, X, y, Z)
    252             y,
    253             to_type=y_inner_mtype,
--> 254             as_scitype=y_input_scitype,
    255         )
    256 

~.\sktime\datatypes\_convert.py in convert_to(obj, to_type, as_scitype, store)
    185         to_type=to_type,
    186         as_scitype=as_scitype,
--> 187         store=store,
    188     )
    189 

~.\sktime\datatypes\_convert.py in convert(obj, from_type, to_type, as_scitype, store)
    122         )
    123 
--> 124     converted_obj = convert_dict[key](obj, store=store)
    125 
    126     return converted_obj

~.\sktime\datatypes\_series\_convert.py in convert_MvS_to_UvS_as_Series(obj, store)
     78 
     79     if len(obj.columns) != 1:
---> 80         raise ValueError("input must be univariate pd.DataFrame, with one column")
     81 
     82     if isinstance(store, dict):

ValueError: input must be univariate pd.DataFrame, with one column
```
**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from sktime.forecasting.model_selection import temporal_train_test_split
from sktime.transformations.series.boxcox import BoxCoxTransformer
from sktime.datasets import load_longley

y, X = load_longley()
y_train, y_test, X_train, X_test = temporal_train_test_split(y, X, test_size=4)

box = BoxCoxTransformer()
box.fit(y_train, X_train)
```
Its madatory that `X` is ignored, as pipelining is also broken now:
```python
pipe = TransformedTargetForecaster(steps=[
    ("box", BoxCoxTransformer()),
    ("forecaster", NaiveForecaster())
])
pipe.fit(y_train, X_train)
y_pred = pipe.predict(fh=fh, X=X_test)
```

**Expected behavior**
No exception

**Additional context**
Pipelining

**Versions**
main branch
</details>
